content: Norman Mattoon Thomas (November 20, 1884 to December 19, 1968) was a leading American socialist, pacifist, and six-time presidential candidate for the Socialist Party of America. The Socialist Party candidate for President of the U.S., Norman Thomas, said this in a 1944 speech: "The American people will never knowingly adopt socialism. But, under the name of "liberalism," they will adopt every fragment of the socialist program, until one day America will be a socialist nation, without knowing how it happened.!" He went on to say: "I no longer need to run as a Presidential Candidate for the Socialist Party. The Democrat Party has adopted our platform."

quote: Originally posted by RW60: quote: Originally posted by mcgreer: quote: Originally posted by RW60: Watched Lou Dobbs on CNN tonight also questioning whether Obama really understands anything about the market. When a CNN journalist raises questions about Obama's economic follies there's a glimmer of hope that the word is getting out to more folks than just my conservative friends who watch FOX. I just heard Obama claim his policies have nothing to do with "gyrations" in the market--seriously, is this guy really as smart as so many people seem to think he is? Those aren't gyrations, the market has been in a dive reacting strongly to what he and the Dems have done over the last 30 days. Gyrations?! I'm so glad we have a president who is such a marvelous speaker...he can destroy capitalism but at least he'll look cool doing it. Thanks libs. Other than the fact that he has a television show, what, exactly, makes Lou Dobbs so credible? He's just one of a parade of talking heads with an opinion. Aren't you tired of all these people with their opinions being forced on you if you try to watch some "news" program? Aren't you tired of being told that you can't think for yourself, and have to have someone else tell you how you should think about a particular event? Wouldn't you just prefer to get the detailed facts about an event? Lou Dobbs is nobody, just like all the rest of them. If you took away his camera and microphone, he'd be just like the guy at the corner bar. A lot of pontificating, and very little substance. My point is about the media. Liberals like to dismiss anything coming from FOX news as automatically invalid opinions but when you start to hear it from CNN and CNBC you can't help but notice and think that perhaps folks are waking up to what they've done by putting a Marxist in the oval office. Looks to me like people are starting to understand why Obama worked so furiously in trying to shut up Joe the plumber--he had Obama pegged. As for Lou Dobbs his opinions weren't "forced" on me; try and give people some credit for knowing the difference between watching opinion shows and watching news. Secondly, my feeling was that Dobbs was agreeing with me, not the other way around. There have been other times and issues when I have strongly disagreed with Dobbs.
reply: What media outlet is broadcasting "news" on television? The last time I deliberately watched it (it'll be one year come mid-April), none of them were. All the heads on CNN, Fox and MSNBC bombard you with all this "analysis" from people who don't even know enough to give a proper prognostication. ABC, CBS, and NBC only give you 30 minutes of news on their national broadcasts, and it's so condensed and badly presented it's useless. A study was just completed (and published as a book) which examined over 82,000 statements and predictions from 284 pundits over a 20-year period. Conclusion? Taken as a whole, they were right less than one-third of the time. And to make matters worse, the better-known pundits were wrong the most often, and were least likely to correct their errors because they put so much stock in their personality and self-esteem. Now, why would I want to waste my time with a resource that is more likely to mis-inform me? And you're doing an absolute disservice to yourself if you inject partisan politics in an already hopeless situation. Hell, the whole idea here is to garner ratings. So, let's raise the noise level, make the banter more provocative, and damn the facts. Finally, I'm going to say it - if you place any credibility on Joe whatshisname, you may have a problem with your information.

content: +++http://www.wowowow.com/post/jim-cramer-barack-obama-mad-money-amateur-hour-our-darkest-moment-video-226443 I’m not asking for the Feds to give us a plunge protection team, to stop declines — as we always thought to be the case under Greenspan. I’m not saying, ‘Mr. President, stare at the Bloomberg quote machine and come to your senses.’ I just want some sign that Obama realizes the market is totally falling apart and his agenda has a big hand in that happening. I thought the prices, the screen, the action, the sense of a vortex down that cannot be stopped, of equities becoming worthless, of savings becoming tattered, of a stock market without bottom. But this time in slow motion, I felt the total lack of control that we all feel right now — the ‘it’s out of my hands,’ the ‘where’s the authority,’ the, ‘Hey, it’s amateur hour at our darkest moment.’ It’s the feeling of capitalism vanishing, businesses capsizing under their own weight — thanks to an administration that doesn’t seem to know or maybe doesn’t care.

content: Norman Mattoon Thomas (November 20, 1884 to December 19, 1968) was a leading American socialist, pacifist, and six-time presidential candidate for the Socialist Party of America. The Socialist Party candidate for President of the U.S., Norman Thomas, said this in a 1944 speech: "The American people will never knowingly adopt socialism. But, under the name of "liberalism," they will adopt every fragment of the socialist program, until one day America will be a socialist nation, without knowing how it happened.!" He went on to say: "I no longer need to run as a Presidential Candidate for the Socialist Party. The Democrat Party has adopted our platform."
